title: Shark

verbs: Play the shark; act with trickery
To play the petty thief; to practice fraud or trickery; to swindle.
Intransitive: to try to catch fish.
To catch or try to catch fish.
Catch or try to catch fish or shellfish
To try to catch fish, whether successfully or not.
nouns: A scaleless fish with a cartilaginous skeleton that has 5 to 7 gill slits on each side of its head.
Any of numerous elongate mostly marine carnivorous fishes with heterocercal caudal fins and tough skin covered with small toothlike scales
Sharks are a group of fish characterized by a cartilaginous skeleton, five to seven gill slits on the sides of the head, and pectoral fins that are not fused to the head.
A scaleless, predatory fish of the superorder Selachimorpha, with a cartilaginous skeleton and 5 to 7 gill slits on each side of its head.

description:
A shark, a large, stealthy fish with many teeth. Generally depicted as a gray shark in full profile facing left, as a tiger, bull, or great white shark hunting in the water. Shown with a white underside and three gills, its pointed nose and teeth-lined mouth curving down to a sharp dorsal fin and long, pointed tail.

Not to be confused with üê¨ Dolphin.
apple_vendor_description: The shark emoji on Apple devices is depicted with a sleek, powerful form, embodying both awe and a hint of caution. Its design showcases Apple's mastery of realistic lighting and gradients, giving its gray skin a subtle sheen and its fins a sharp, defined edge.  The slightly open mouth and piercing eye, rendered with Apple's characteristic detail, suggest the creature's primal nature, often used playfully to represent danger, the ocean, or a bold, decisive action in messages sent on Apple devices.
